node.text:
Last week I ran across a posting from @180degreefarm harvesting lemons prior to a freeze coming their way. Scott was so nice to send some lemons my way when I commented how beautiful they looked. 
I started following @180degreefarm a little while ago after watching an episode on Growing a Greener World when they were interviewed by @joegardener. The story of how they got into farming really stuck out to me, and their mission of giving organically nutrient dense food to those families who are fighting cancer through their “food fight” program. With his generosity I am so happy to experience the fruit of Scott and Nicole’s hard work. 
I am now trying to come up the best ways to use the best lemons I’ve ever seen. So far, I’ve made fresh lemonade, lemon infused local honey, squeezed lemon juice for cooking, and we will be having lemon chicken for dinner this week. Thanks again Scott for your kindness! 
#180degreefarm
#fyffebackyardfarm 
#FBFgranville

#smallscalefarming

Keeping dollars in the local economy, supporting small scale organic growers and low food miles. The avos also taste amazing 👌🥑

We're still taking orders for veg boxes that will be ready for you this Thursday, the link to the latest form is in the bio.

node.text:
Harvesting kale. We love this leafy green as its packed with antioxidants and vitals A, C and K. Its a grerat winter crop for its cold hardiness and prolonged harvest. Our farm is located in the USDA Hardiness Zone 5a with average annual extreme minimum temperatures of -20F to -15F. With much of Vermont in zones 4b and 4a our farm is in a unique micro climate in its proximity to lake Champlain creating a slightly warmer and more favourable winter growing environment. By also having our crops in a greenhouse under remay we can typically move about three USDA zones to the “south”. Lots of veggies going out to those that enjoy good food. 

#wintergreens #winter #wintergreenhouse #winterproduction #sustainableagriculture #localfood #agroecology #organicvegetables #organicgardening #growvegetables #notill #foodharvest #freshvegetables #SupportYourLocalFarmer #SupportLocalFarms #LocalBusiness  #SmallBusiness  #SmallscaleFarming #PesticideFree #ChemicalFree #OrganicVeg  #Organic  #OrganicHarvest #KnowYourFarmer #FarmToTable #vtfarmers #madeinvermont #vtgrownt #livingsoilgrown #soilhealth

It’s harvest day 🌱🌱🌱

#microgreens #shoplocal #supportlocal #smallscalefarming #crispandspicy #womenfarmers

For a good cup of tea always use freshly boiled water and brew for 3-4 minutes. But... for an EXTRA good cup of tea choose a tea that's organically grown by farmers who are also the landowners 🌱💚

In a world where most of the tea is produced on large plantations, we're proud to support the small-scale farmer through fair trade. Enjoy organic, fair trade tea with Trade Aid's new-look range ✨

Available now in beautiful new-look packs 👇🏼
https://www.tradeaid.org.nz/shop/food-tea/

node.text:
Whatever it is you want to do pick a starting point and just plug away!!
If I have any advice for someone who wants to farm just start!!!
Buy some seeds, get some soil, drive around and look for free lumber.
Get out there and sell yourself as a grower, meet other farmers and pick their brain.
This greenhouse and the grow room is all out of recycled materials. Its not perfect by any means but it will grow food.
Our farm is done for the season but we press on.
Find a saw, find a hammer find a drill.
Get a shovel and a hoe and a rake.
If you can't find it borrow it but just start.
You will never regret the beginning no matter how hard and long those steps take.
.
.
.
.
#backyardgardening #eatyourgreens #farm #familygarden #farmlife #familyfarm #gardeningwithkids #gardentotable #greenthumb #growyourownfood #growyourown #growsomethinggreen #growwhatyoueat #homegrownveggies #heirloomseeds #yqg #knowyourfarmer #marketfarming #microfarm #regenerativefarming #smallfarms #supportyourlocalfarmer #smallscalefarming #seedsaving #urbanfarming #vegetables #veggiegarden #vegetablegarden

node.text:
It was a lot warmer when this picture was taken, but I still have carrots in the ground! I’ve taken the past few weeks off from Saturday veggie boxes, and the break was much needed, and extremely relaxing. I’ve spent a lot of time organizing my home and garage, and I’m pretty sure I’ve eaten my weight in homemade baked goods.

I’ll be resuming veggie boxes next week for as long as weather permits. The tentative list for Saturday includes lettuce, chard, and carrots.
.
.
.
.
.
.
#supportsmallbusiness #womenwhofarm #farmher #beyondorganic #soilhealth #smallscalefarming

But we come here not just with questions, we also propose answers and solutions. 💛

You are welcome to join us and co-create them with us. 🌱

Oh boy, I’ve really messed up this algorithm thing...but sometimes I just need a break from Instagram you know?! Gotta hand it to all you consistent content creators out there, it must feel like a full time job! 

Anyway, I’m going to make a wreath this afternoon (hopefully in some sunshine) with all this pretty foliage that was cut from our property yesterday. I may even attempt to film a reel of it, we’ll see how it goes lol

If you’re excited to see us back on your feed, please give us a like or a share, that’s how we’re gonna get our name back out into this online world 💫

node.text: Chicken quarantine prep.... Our hen "bok-down" plan has come together nicely in the end, after a few days of panicking about the logistics. The inside of their shed has been scrubbed out, rearranged and new perches added and we've created a new outdoor area, tempted to add a little chuck swing to the perch outside! Over the next few days I'll leave them in here longer each day accustoming them to it before 14th.

node.text:
“Live a quiet life, and work with your hands.”

If you’re a new follower to my feed, Welcome! I’m Amorette, a second year flower farmer in Atlanta, GA. Flower farming checks all the boxes. When my arms aren’t full of hand curated flowers, I am working a 60x60ft plot of land until my fingers bleed and the tips feel like sandpaper. The combination of hard work in solitude and buckets of artisan florals fuels my creative bent like nothing else on the planet. Flower buckets and band aids are how I roll. Thanks for rolling along with me!

node.text:
This week we are happy to share with you @sullifarmandkitchen 👩‍🌾 They strive to build community around food, to have relationships with the families that consume their product.  They want you to know where your food comes from, how it was produced, how it affects you, and how it affects the environment around you. 💛

@farmstandrevival’s NEWEST Featured Farm: 👍 @sullifarmandkitchen

“Here at Sullifarm, we embrace a rather full-circle scene in agriculture.  One that’s all about restoration, repair, healing and health.  We don’t just grow food, we strive to regenerate our soils and pastures in the process. 
.
Pasture-raising animals according to their natures thus creating the tastiest and healthiest food products in a local and regenerative farm setting.”

Hooks, TX
📸: @sullifarmandkitchen
~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
Join the movement! 👩‍🌾 👍 Let’s Revive Small Local Farms 🙌🏻 We feature small regenerative growers 👩‍🌾 👨‍🌾 from around the world! 🥕
~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
Support Us by checkin’ out our SMALL-SCALE FARMING APPAREL! 🤩💚 Link in bio --> @farmstandrevival *1 % Of Profits Donated Tp Supporting Small Farms!
~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

node.text:
Good Morning Lewiston and Auburn! We hope you are all warm, safe and soon with power!

We just want to take a moment to thank everyone who came out to make this summer season great! We really had a phenomenal year and we really appreciate the awesome opportunity to be able to serve the community some of the freshest, nutrient dense, in-season, locally grown produce that Androscoggin County has to offer.

While our effort is great its reciprocal of the love received from everyone in the community. The consumer, the @lewistonfarmersmarket including all their volunteers and sponsors, everyone at the @goodfoodbus , all the different farmers, producers, and vendors that we get to work with on a daily basis, the collaborative efforts with @chirpcreekfarm , everyone on the @goodfoodcouncil_la , and anyone else in the cycle that we missed - Thank You! We love working with you all!

🌬❄🌧🌬❄🌧🌬❄🌧🌬❄🌧🌬❄🌧🌬❄🌧🌬

Because of the ensuing winter weather we will not be setting up outside anymore until the Spring Markets return. 

🌨☃️❄🌨☃️❄🌨☃️❄🌨☃️❄🌨☃️❄🌨☃️❄🌨

We are in the process of setting up an ecommerce solution off of our website so you will be able to order direct, pay online, and have the option to set up a delivery/Pick up time at your convenience. You wont have to leave your house this winter to access our fresh eggs, micro greens, carrots, frozen blueberries.. Have them delivered! 🚙🚙😀😊😎

🌨❄☃️🌬🌨❄☃️🌬🌨❄☃️🌬🌨☃️🌬🌨❄☃️🌬

In the meantime you can still access our produce off the Lewiston Farmers Market's Pre-Sale landing page which is located here: https://www.goodfoodbus.org/shop

Thank You very much and please stay tuned! We look forward to continuing serving the Greater Lewiston/Auburn community and as things develop we will post them here!

#ElisHomestead #thankyou #thanks #SmallScaleAG #urbanfarm #urbanfarms #urbanag #urbanfarmstand #smallscalefarming #smallscaleagriculture #smallbusiness #urbanfarming #Maine #lewistonmaine #grovestreet #urbanagriculture #intensive #biodiversity #foodsovereignty #lewistonfarmersmarket #localmarkets  #localfood #nutrition #mainemarkets #buylocal #summer #winter #wintermarket #contactlessdelivery #ecommerce

node.text:
Our garlic came out today! We had the sweetest lil helper this year, my niece Erica and big naughty Alfred lamb too. There are lots of small ones but also lots of bigger beauties. It's been a scary season with big losses to the wet weather and mold. I feel so much relief to see it out and safe! We also have 4 other varieties we have started this year. 
Mother nature always teaching me more each season and always keeping me on my toes! 
#smallscalefarming #aussiegarlic #chemicalfree
Photo cred @jiminaughton

node.text:
The first step in making our organic wholegrain spelt flour. All of our flours are milled on the farm from local Suffolk crops. 🌾 ⠀
⠀
🍰  We love @Henriettainman 's easy cake recipe using our spelt flour: Cream 180g soft butter with 180g sugar, then alternately add 180g wholegrain spelt flour (mixed with a pinch of salt and 2 1/2 tsp baking powder) with 3 eggs until just combined. Transfer to a greased & lined 20cm cake tin. Bake for about 30 mins at 180C until golden brown and bouncy when lightly pressed.⠀
⠀
Come by the shop for your local, organic flours and produce. We're open 9am-5pm with social distancing measures in place. ⠀
⠀
#organicflour #speltflour #organic #smallscalefarming #regenerativeagriculture #sustainableagriculture #knowyourfarmer #farmtotable #localproduce #supportlocal #madeinsuffolk #stoneground #suffolk #suffolkfarming #maplefarmkelsale

December 5th was World soil day and I'm reminded of my grandparents and the land that they've acquired.
Did you know that after slavery ended, for another 100 years, black farmers were treated misfairly, that it was extremely hard for them to get loans or to qualify for assistance in times of drought? 

In 2012, the number of black farmers in the United States was 44,629. Nationally black farmers were 1.4 percent of the country's 3.2 million farmers in 2012.  Somewhere, we began to look down on farming and thought it was beneath us.  I'm hoping that this pandemic has made us realize that we need to grow our own food, support our communities and abolish food deserts where we live and work.

node.accessibility_caption: Photo by Farmer Brooke in Victoria, British Columbia. Image may contain: 1 person, standing, plant, outdoor and nature.

node.text:
2020 has been a year of major change and this photo describes it perfectly. Like these marigolds I am barely hanging on. Going from having a job, not having a job for 7 months due to COVID restrictions and feeling overwhelmed I took a break from gardening the one thing that I enjoyed most about my new house. My hope for the winter is to have a moment to relax before our little baby boy arrives late March and still be able to plant out a really good garden in the spring. Here’s to hoping and praying that 2021 is a better year for the garden! 
 .
.
.
.

node.text:
The end result, #medlarjelly! The first picture is of the #medlars fully #bletted. The taste was pretty nondescript, slightly sweet, creamy, but pretty bland.  The scent when they were cooking down however was intoxicating! I couldn’t put my finger on it but there were hints of rose, citrus, apple, quince and even some peppery notes. But none of those describe it accurately. 

The #jelly is delicate and lovely tasting as well as being beautiful. I’ll probably try it with #pomonapectin next time to try and reduce the sugar as the sweetness almost overwhelms the taste. 

Overall a big thumbs up and I can’t wait for next year’s harvest!
.
.
.
#bluedogfarmmetchosin #metchosin #metchosinbc #silvopasture #growyourownfood #smallfarm #smallfarms #smallscalefarming

node.accessibility_caption: Photo by Nicole Wellness on December 05, 2020. Image may contain: food.

node.text:
Keen for some Nonna’s Tears? Like all good things, it takes time. We’re growing our ingredients from scratch - organically and without fossil fuelled tilling machines means we can get the most ethically produced, low impact products to you! No exploited harvesting staff, no middle men, plants grown from seed and irrigated off our dam filled with stored rainwater, no chlorine and fluoride contaminating and degrading our soil’s life web, no synthetic fertiliser bypassing microbes and raising the lands salinity, just good old fashioned, deeply nourishing organic fertility made from our free range, pasture raised animals - what we grow with their rich manure is a direct reflection of their healthy diets and lifestyle too. Our whole ecosystem is closely observed and understood which is the beauty of a holistic permaculture system.
Saying our “preserves are made with love” seems like such an understatement because well before the ingredients germinate from seed, there’s love there.
Thanks for the support everyone!
.
.
.
.
.
#smallscale #smallscalefarming #permaculture #veggiegarden #shoplocal #supportsmallbusiness #eatdrinkgippsland #ethicallymade #knowwhereyourfoodcomesfrom #offgrid #slowfood #organic #organicgardening #organicfood #healthyfood #gardening #gardeningaustralia #preserve #hotsauce #pickles #freerange #smallbatch #artisan #artisanal

node.text: In this quick video I outline how in space different crops I grow on my farm. You can use a dibbler to crop space but I find that I’m happy using the method outlined! I tend to grow tomatoes (transplanted) March-September. I stop my production a bit early to ensure that my greens can mature before the daylight hours dwindle too much. Because I don’t have super long season tomatoes I space them a bit more intensive than most. Longer term=needs more space for roots 🍅🌶

👉We Are Open - Free Delivery Of Our Fresh Microgreens Right To Your Door❤️ ⁠
⁠
Order you 1st FREE box of Microgreens for delivery on Tuesday Or Friday - Send me a DM Or leave a comment 👇⁠
⁠
🙏 Thank you for supporting 💚your small local businessowners 😊 and hereby also help the environment and support local food security.⁠
⁠
It's a lot of hard work to run a business with just 2 people who wear all the hats.⁠
⁠
Me and my husband share these hats in our small business: ⁠
✅ farmer⁠
✅ social media specialist⁠
✅ videographer⁠
✅ accountant⁠
✅ cleaner⁠
✅ secretary⁠
✅ delivery driver⁠
✅ Mom⁠
✅ Dad⁠
....... and I am sure many more tasks.⁠
⁠
I'ts great because we LOVE what we do but it's a heavy task to carry sometimes as life throws curveballs at all of us, as you for sure know.⁠
⁠
Thank you all for your ongoing support and for helping us grow organically and provide you with the best possible #leafygreens and feed our community fresh greens!⁠
⁠
Any Questions ❓- please let me know⁠
.

node.text:
Happy World Soil Day 2020! What can we say? We owe our lives and our livelihoods to this dirt. In my years in agriculture, I have watched soil earn growing appreciation and have shared farmers’ journeys to discovering their own soil food web. It’s a whole world of wonder and my life is richer for having soil in it. 🧡 We would love for you to leave a comment about your soil. 
Posted by @megan.alluvial for @growingformarketmagazine #growingformarket #worldsoilday #worldsoilday2020 #soil #soilhealth #dirt #notjustdirt

node.text: Everything has dried out quite quickly this year at Clovelly. It was a good, wet spring but the unusual winds and no rain in the last couple of weeks have dried everything off. Last night we had rain- glorious rain!- so hopefully everything has a little refresh. Lovely to know there’s a bit more water in our tanks, too.

node.text:
At 21 Acres, it’s no secret that we love soil. The soil gives us so much. Healthy soil is a valuable resource, stewarded by people who care about the longevity of our planet–and our ability to continue farming and eating delicious food for generations to come.
Today, Saturday Dec. 5, #WorldSoilDay, take action by learning about the many facets of what goes into healthy soil, how healthy soils can help mitigate climate impacts, and how you can get involved. Enjoy the articles and videos on the #21AcresBlog. And, a huge thank you to 21 Acres' Becca Jordan for pulling together all these resources. https://bit.ly/37zeeRb #SoilViodiversity #4soil .
.
.
.
.

node.text:
Testpaket + Sammelaktion für die Gruft‼️
Neben unserem bestehenden Pilot-Abo Programm, wollen wir auch allen Unentschlossenen bis Weihnachten die Möglichkeit geben, einmalig ein Testpaket um 12 € zu bestellen.
Geliefert wird am:
11-12.12. (Anmeldung bis 7.12 18 Uhr)
18-19.12 und 
23.12. (solange der Vorrat reicht) 

Zusätzlich wollen wir zu Beginn der kalten Jahreszeit jenen Menschen unter die Arme greifen, die ganz besonders auf unsere Hilfe angewiesen sind. Darum starten wir eine Sammelaktion für die Gruft. In Absprache mit @caritasoesterreich werden zur Zeit besonders folgende Produkte benötigt:
Nagelzwicker, Rasierschaum, Süßes in allen Varianten (ohne Alkoholzusatz), Isomatten, Rucksäcke, Schlafsäcke. Zusätzlich sind haltbare Lebensmittel wie Fleisch- und Fischdosen, Sugo, Chilli, Bohnen- und Gulaschsuppe gerne gesehen. 
Um es euch auf Grund der jetzigen Situation einfacher zu machen, werden wir bei jeder Auslieferung unserer Microgreens an unsere Abo-TeilnehmerInnen und all jene die ein Testpaket bestellen, die Sachspenden entgegennehmen und gesammelt nach Weihnachten übergeben. 
Wenn ihr daran teilnehmen wollt, bitten wir euch zwecks Planung einen Tag vor dem Liefertermin Bescheid zu geben. 🌱

node.text:
Christmas Meats 🎄🥓 

Earlier this week was our big monthly meat club delivery day and it was another new one for our members. 

Pork shoulder cured in juniper, clove and bay, smoked over cherry wood and then cut into chunky lardons. 

As always we had to road test it before release. We were loving the earthy flavours of the juniper and bay and the hint of clove made it taste nice and seasonal. 

And of course, we kept a good few portions back for ourselves...... 😋 

Be silly not to 😉

#lynbreckcroft #meatclub #littlemountainmeatclub #localfood #rarebreedpork #knowyourpork #knowyourfood #christmas #buylocal #supportlocal #microbutchery #smallscalefarming

node.text:
Loquat Jam. I love the community of growers and foodies in the Southern Highlands. Got a message today that a locals tree was covered in Loquat and that the sugar must be up as last night the fruit bats were into them. Popped in and picked 2 buckets. The big question is who has a great recipe for Loquat jam? I understand they're native to south East Asia so I'm surprised this tree is thriving so well in a cool climate area that is often affected by frosts. Suggestions please! 
-
-
-
-
#loquattree #loquatjam #loquatfruit #smallscalefarming #cropswap #bowraljam Steve Rosa

Such a strong community of folks who share a vision for #fairfood and such strong values of earth care and people care. 

Thanks everyone who brought today together, to the great and diverse range of speakers from industry, the farmers, all of the contributors of amazing food @threeblueducks / @thebreadsocial / @stoneandwood who spoiled us and good time all round.

Coming at ya Monday. I’ve got my list ready, coffee in the mug, and intent set on getting it done! 
•
It’s #meetmygoatmonday with @theyounghomestead 
•
For those of you who haven’t met him, this is Trevor. Trevor and his sister Annabelle are one year old Nigerian Dwarf goats.

node.accessibility_caption: Photo by Natalie in Lüneburg, Germany. Image may contain: food.

node.text:
This week we are happy to share with you @sullifarmandkitchen 👩‍🌾 They strive to build community around food, to have relationships with the families that consume their product.  They want you to know where your food comes from, how it was produced, how it affects you, and how it affects the environment around you. 💛

@farmstandrevival’s NEWEST Featured Farm: 👍 @sullifarmandkitchen

“Here at Sullifarm, we embrace a rather full-circle scene in agriculture.  One that’s all about restoration, repair, healing and health.  We don’t just grow food, we strive to regenerate our soils and pastures in the process. 
.
Pasture-raising animals according to their natures thus creating the tastiest and healthiest food products in a local and regenerative farm setting.”

Hooks, TX
📸: @sullifarmandkitchen
~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

node.accessibility_caption: Photo by 🍇Garden Community🍇 on November 26, 2020. Image may contain: outdoor.

node.text: We have been so busy getting the farm ready for winter but I’m happy to say we got the new greenhouse up and running right before the first snowfall of the season. It’s not perfect but I’m proud of how it came out and happy to have more space for our #microgreens 🌱Building a greenhouse from scratch was the easy part, growing in Tahoe during the winter will be the challenging part. 🌱🌱🌱 #HighAltitudeFarming
